definition: to pursue public affairs
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to carry out official duties and observe the law
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly

sentences.english: You shall be of good behaviour and keep the peace.
sentences.chinese: 你必须行为良好，奉公守法。

sentences.english: A law-abiding person needs to keep his (her) nose clean.
sentences.chinese: 奉公遵法的人应该避免制造麻烦。

sentences.english: In Chinese history, there are many honest and dedicated people.
sentences.chinese: 在中国历史上，有很多廉洁奉公的人。

sentences.english: They kept Service Management Group clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直使服务管理公司奉公守法。

sentences.english: A law-abiding person needs to keep his nose clean.
sentences.chinese: 奉公守法的人应该避免制造麻烦。

sentences.english: This story gave rise to the idiom "be wholeheartedly devoted to public duty."
sentences.chinese: 人们根据这个故事引申出“克己奉公”这句成语。

sentences.english: The First Clerk of the Magistracy must be law-abiding and honesty itself.
sentences.chinese: 法庭的书记长必须奉公守法而且为人十分正直。

sentences.english: Stick to the principles and law-abiding.
Most of the Civil Servants in our country are honest in performing their official duties.
sentences.chinese: 我们国家的大多数公务员都是廉洁奉公的。

sentences.english: In a prosperous society, every one does one's bit.
sentences.chinese: 在一个繁荣的社会，每个人都不会克己奉公。

sentences.english: The candidate have a mr. clean image.
sentences.chinese: 这位候选人给人一种廉洁奉公的印象。
